item.title: RT by @gawanmac: It is a system of policies which have seen the EU fund dictatorships, for example in Sudan, and camps in places like Libya where asylum seekers face torture, being sold into slavery, or murder. https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2021/12/06/the-secretive-libyan-prisons-that-keep-migrants-out-of-europe
item.dc:creator: @stand_for_all
item.description:
It is a system of policies which have seen the EU fund dictatorships, for example in Sudan, and camps in places like Libya where asylum seekers face torture, being sold into slavery, or murder.
newyorker.com/magazine/2021/‚Ä¶

item.title: RT by @gawanmac: These aren't limited actions, or the actions of individual states. They are part of a wider outsourcing and externalisation policy by the EU regarding asylum seekers, designed to prevent the most vulnerable people reaching its territory and penalising those who do.
item.dc:creator: @stand_for_all
item.description: These aren't limited actions, or the actions of individual states. They are part of a wider outsourcing and externalisation policy by the EU regarding asylum seekers, designed to prevent the most vulnerable people reaching its territory and penalising those who do.

item.title: RT by @gawanmac: Greece has a track record of shooting those trying to enter to seek asylum. After one such shooting in 2020 the European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen even praised the Greek authorities for their actions.
item.dc:creator: @stand_for_all
item.description: Greece has a track record of shooting those trying to enter to seek asylum. After one such shooting in 2020 the European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen even praised the Greek authorities for their actions.

item.title: R to @CepeSmith: The UK govt has literally been legislating to limit the right to protest and to criminalise it. The Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Act took effect today.
item.dc:creator: @gawanmac
item.description: The UK govt has literally been legislating to limit the right to protest and to criminalise it. The Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Act took effect today.

item.title: Honestly assumed this was a reference to the UK.

item.title: RT by @gawanmac: Hi Fly's CEO, Paolo Mirpuri, founded @mirpuri_org "with the aim of contributing to a better world". Tonight, @hifly_airline will profit from taking mums and grandmothers from their families and sending a gay man into danger in Nigeria. Email him today. https://detentionaction.e-activist.com/page/108644/action/1
item.dc:creator: @DetentionAction
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @gawanmac: Nothing to be proud of.
Today the govt is planning to force Adeniyi Raji on a plane to Nigeria -where homosexuality is illegal & he's received threats to his life.
While they cynically use a Pride flag on their profile - this is the true face of this govt‚Äôs hostile environment.
item.dc:creator: @FreefromTorture
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @gawanmac: People willing to cause harm to GRT people for just existing. Like Johnny Delaney's murderers who thought it was fine to kill him as he was "just a Gypsy".
This, with the new Human Rights laws are coming to remove our ethnicity. If you let it happen to us, your rights are next.
item.dc:creator: @GallagherGRT
item.description:
People willing to cause harm to GRT people for just existing. Like Johnny Delaney's murderers who thought it was fine to kill him as he was "just a Gypsy".

This, with the new Human Rights laws are coming to remove our ethnicity. If you let it happen to us, your rights are next.

item.title: RT by @gawanmac: Their homes and motors can be seized, leaving a whole family homeless in the middle of nowhere, if a member of the public feels someone towing a caravan will cause damage, disruption or distress. On top of fines, social services may be involved as the family are left homeless 2/3

item.title: RT by @gawanmac: Today the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Act come into power. Part 4 of this new law was aimed at removing the nomadic right of Gypsies, Roma and Travellers in the UK. There are no transit sites for families to access and avoid trespass. Instead a new law states that 1/3
item.dc:creator: @GallagherGRT

item.title: R to @palacecapper: Bi and pansexual people, trans men, sex workers, rape victims, and any queer person who might get pregnant and then need or want to terminate. Perhaps you have limited experience and imagination of the variety and reality of queer lives, so I hope this has been helpful to you.
item.dc:creator: @gawanmac
item.description: Bi and pansexual people, trans men, sex workers, rape victims, and any queer person who might get pregnant and then need or want to terminate. Perhaps you have limited experience and imagination of the variety and reality of queer lives, so I hope this has been helpful to you.

item.title: R to @palacecapper: Yes, many queer/LGBTQ+ people can get pregnant (and may want to terminate), what do you not understand about this? Regardless, the other point stands about solidarity over bodily autonomy. On vaccines, no one was forced into having a vaccine (AND there were many protests re vax).
item.dc:creator: @gawanmac
item.description: Yes, many queer/LGBTQ+ people can get pregnant (and may want to terminate), what do you not understand about this? Regardless, the other point stands about solidarity over bodily autonomy. On vaccines, no one was forced into having a vaccine (AND there were many protests re vax).

item.title: RT by @gawanmac: *CALL TO ACTION: Save Masafer Yatta!* URGENT need of international volunteers in #Palestine to support the Masafer Yatta community in resisting mass demolitions. To find out more click here: https://bit.ly/3A8ZpVk #SaveMasaferYatta #Palestine #volunteer #MasaferYatta

item.title:
RT by @gawanmac: This was a seriously vulnerable child whose welfare needs are being put second to the needs of the state to police and enforce immigration rules.
And this has been happening to asylum-seeking young people for some time.
item.dc:creator: @BennnyH
item.description:
This was a seriously vulnerable child whose welfare needs are being put second to the needs of the state to police and enforce immigration rules.

And this has been happening to asylum-seeking young people for some time.

item.title:
RT by @gawanmac: It was 8pm at night. This teenage boy had just been through a traumatic experience. He was tired.
What he needed in that moment was a bed and some rest somewhere safe.
What he didn't need was to be grilled by the police about his 'illegal' mode of entry.
item.dc:creator: @BennnyH
item.description:
It was 8pm at night. This teenage boy had just been through a traumatic experience. He was tired.

What he needed in that moment was a bed and some rest somewhere safe.

What he didn't need was to be grilled by the police about his 'illegal' mode of entry.

item.title:
RT by @gawanmac: The first question the social worker asked me was "does he look like the age he says he is?". I said yes he does.
Immediately the people entrusted to protect this child hold him in suspicion.
There were no questions about how I viewed his welfare, whether he was in distress.
item.dc:creator: @BennnyH
item.description:
The first question the social worker asked me was "does he look like the age he says he is?". I said yes he does.

Immediately the people entrusted to protect this child hold him in suspicion.

There were no questions about how I viewed his welfare, whether he was in distress.

item.title: R to @gawanmac: Not to imply, of course, that no one is yet doing any work on care for lgbtq+ elders. @OpeningDoorsUK offers specialist training to care homes and others - you can donate to support their work at https://openingdoorslondon.eu.rit.org.uk/donate/donate/5/credit-card
